intro: Doliocarpus strictus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed doliocarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and compound leaves with serrated margins. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color, and it produces small, fleshy berries as its fruit. Doliocarpus strictus is often found in moist, shaded environments within rainforests.
